title: CFD modelling of convective heat transfer from a window with adjacent venetian blinds

references.title: Convective Heat Transfer from a Window with a Venetian Blinds: Detail Modeling, ASHRAE Transaction, pp 1031-1037, ASHRAE
references.raw: Convective Heat Transfer from a Window with a Venetian Blinds: Detail Modeling, ASHRAE Transaction, pp 1031-1037, ASHRAE Philips, J., Naylor, D., Harrison,  S.J., Oosthuizen, P.H. 2001. Experimental Study of Free Convection at an Indoor Glazing Surface with a Venetian Blind, HVAC&R Research, Vol 4, no 2, pp 153- 166, ASHRAE Curcija, D., Gross, W.P. 1993. Prediction of the Multicellular Flow Regime of Natural Convection in Fenestration Glazing Cavities, ASHRAE Transactions, Vol 103 (1), pp. 1009-1020, ASHRAE Zitzmann, T., Cook, M., Rees, S.J., Pfromer, P., Marjanovic, Lj. 2005: Modelling free convection and heat transfer in a room with CFD and validation (accepted for BS 2005) - 716 -

references.raw: Philips, J., Naylor, D., Oosthuizen, P.H., Harrison, S.J. 2001. Numerical Study of Convective and Radiative Heat Transfer from a Window Glazing with a Venetian Blind, HVAC&R Research, Vol7, no4, pp 282-402, ASHRAE Ye, P., Harrison, S.J. , Oosthuzien, P.H. 1999.

abstract: This paper provided a solid foundation for the subsequent EPSRC project on double facades. It emphasises the need for three-dimensional CFD modelling. Marjanovic wrote the paper and is the lead author
